intro: Spyridium parvifolium, commonly known as the small-leaved spyridium, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Rhamnaceae family and is characterized by its small, ovate leaves and clusters of yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is found in regions such as New South Wales and Victoria. It is a shrub that can reach up to 1 meter in height, with woody stems and small, persistent leaves. Spyridium parvifolium is often used in native gardens due to its ornamental value and adaptability to various environmental conditions.
